Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Perioperative 5-FU in Colon Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: randomised patients with newly diagnosed, nonmetastatic adenocarcinoma of the colon

Participants.evidence: patients with newly diagnosed, nonmetastatic adenocarcinoma of the colon

Intervention.evidence: receive either continuous infusional 5-FU for 7 days starting within 24 hours after curative resection (arm A) or no perioperative 5-FU (arm B)

Objective.evidence: evaluated the effect of perioperative fluorouracil (5-FU) on overall survival (OS) in colon cancer patients

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was OS in patients with Dukes’ B3 and C disease

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using permutated blocks with dynamic balancing

Blinding.evidence: The trial was open-label with no blinding

Number_Randomised.evidence: From August 1993 to May 2000, 855 patients were randomised (arm A: 427; arm B: 428)

Number_Analysed.evidence: The trial was terminated early due to slow accrual

Result_Outcome.evidence: no significant difference in OS [median 10.3 years (95% CI 8.4, 13.2) for arm A and 9.3 years (95% CI 5.7, 12.3) for arm B, p = 0.178]

Harms.evidence: Eighteen percent of arm A patients experienced grade 3 or greater toxicity

Funding.evidence: funding was provided by the NCI Intergroup
